title: Write an inequality in two variables
prompt: Anna is analyzing her greeting card business's profits. She wants more than 40% of the price p of her greeting cards to be profit. If c represents Anna's cost to make a greeting card, which inequality represents the desired relationship between price and cost?
hint: Profit is the difference between price and cost.
feedback:
The inequality 

<math>  <mrow>   <mi>p</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.4</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow>
</math>   

 represents a profit of more than 40%. The left side of the inequality is the profit, price minus cost. This should be greater than 40% of the price. Remember to convert 40% to a decimal by dividing by 100 and dropping the percent sign. The result is 

<math>  <mrow>   <mi>p</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0.4</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow>
</math>
